Script: Hello and welcome to our study! My name is Epi, and I will be interviewing you today. Thank you for taking the time to participate. Please have a seat in the chair in front of me and let me know when you’re ready.
We will be doing a few activities and asking some questions. There are no right or wrong answers, so feel free to share your thoughts and experiences.
Please remember that your participation is entirely voluntary. You can withdraw at any time without providing a reason. Are you okay with continuing?
Great!
I’d like to ask you a few questions about personal experiences. Could you tell me about one of your best memories, something that truly made you happy?
That sounds fantastic! What was it about that experience that made it so special for you?
Thank you for sharing.
Have you ever encountered something that you found really disgusting or repulsive?
Could you please explain the smell of that situation?
Thank you!
Could you tell me about a time when you felt sad or disappointed?
How did that experience affect you, and how did you cope with it?
Thank you for sharing.
Can you recall a situation where you felt really frustrated or angry?
What was the most frustrating aspect about that situation?
When thinking back to that experience, do you still get angry?
Thank you for sharing.

Your next task is a working memory task. I will read you a list of words and I want you to sort them alphabetically. If I say Pear, Apple, Orange, I want you to read back to me Apple, Orange, Pear. Are you ready?
Bed, Rest, Awake
Tired, Dream, Snooze, Nap
Peace. Yawn. Snore. Blanket. Drowzy.
Very good. Thank you.
Could you count backward from 1022 in steps of 13 as quickly as possible?
Try to do it faster, and make sure it’s correct. If you make a mistake, please start again from 1022.
Wait wait wait
I am sorry for the interruption. Please start again from 1022.
Great. Thank you.
Thank you so much for participating in all these tasks and sharing your thoughts with us today. We really appreciate your participation. Have a great rest of your day!
